channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump held Americans’ Thanksgiving travel hostage to force through health care cuts, Democratic senator suggests
item.description: Sen. Tammy Duckworth wants to know why the FAA and Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy haven't shown the safety data behind their order to cut flights...

item.title: Robert L. Stirm, Returning P.O.W. in Pulitzer-Winning Photo, Dies at 92
item.description: The image immortalized a Vietnam veteran’s joyous homecoming to his beaming family, but it hid the truth about his unraveling marriage.

item.title: Trump Was Not Invited to Cheney’s Memorial Service
item.description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a once-powerful Republican, turned on Mr. Trump last year by announcing he would vote for Vice President Kamala Har...

item.title: Reports of the retail store’s demise have been greatly exaggerated
item.description: Particularly during the holiday season, stores have a central part to play in the shopping process. It all comes down to providing the right experienc...

item.title: To Meld A.I. With Supercomputers, National Labs Are Picking Up the Pace
item.description: A.I. has added urgency to the U.S. national laboratories that have been sites of cutting-edge scientific research, leading to deals with tech giants l...

item.title: ‘Yes, it is an ambitious, crazy thing’: Scenes from the Kennedy Center’s Saudi-U.S. AI mind-meld, with Trump, MBS, Musk and Huang
item.description: “While we were taking the picture, I said, ’Could you make it $1.5 trillion?’” Trump said about Saudi investment. “So he’s got something to think abou...

item.title: The OBBBA has a significant tax change for founders tucked away inside, lifting the cap to $75 million with many opportunities to turbo-charge business
item.description: The QSBS reforms in the OBBBA are more than just tax tweaks—they’re a strategic invitation to growth, raising capital and exiting.

item.title: Ukraine and Europe Chafe at Being Excluded From U.S.-Russian Peace Plan
item.description: Some in Kyiv expressed confusion over the Trump administration’s multiple diplomatic tracks as Washington tries to revive negotiations.

item.title: Home Depot says a deep funk in the housing market is responsible for its sales slump: ‘Our customers are homeowners’
item.description: The U.S. housing market is currently experiencing historic stagnation.

item.title: Ferry Crashed After Operator Was Distracted by His Phone, Officials Say
item.description: The operator and two other officers were charged with gross negligence after the ferry ran aground in South Korea on Wednesday carrying 267 people.

item.title: The Hunt Is On for Bears in Japan After Deadly Attacks
item.description: Residents in the northern region of Akita are living in fear after dozens of assaults on humans. Riot police and the army have been sent to help.

item.title: Trump Meeting With Saudi Prince Showcased Prince’s Makeover, and America’s
item.description: Mohammed bin Salman was briefly a global pariah after the killing of a Saudi dissident. But he has rebuilt his image as a deal-maker and influential i...

item.title: Ukraine and Europe Chafe at Being Excluded From U.S.-Russian Peace Plan
item.description: Some in Kyiv expressed confusion over the Trump administration’s multiple diplomatic tracks as Washington tries to revive negotiations.

item.title: Cheney Service to Underscore How Politics Has Changed Since He Was in Office
item.description: As the former vice president is honored at Washington National Cathedral on Thursday, many eyes will focus on who comes — and who does not.

item.title: Israeli Strikes Kill at Least 25 in Gaza Amid Cease-Fire, Officials Say
item.description: Israel’s military said it had launched attacks across Gaza after Palestinian militants shot at its troops. The six-week-old cease-fire has been pierce...
